definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.chinese: 退休费问题是特别棘手的。

sentences.english: Jack began to buff and puff when asked awkward question.
sentences.chinese: 要是问到棘手的问题，杰克就开始颠三倒四地胡说。

sentences.english: However, the second problem is even more bothersome.
sentences.chinese: 然而，第二个问题更加棘手。

sentences.english: The control of azimuth is a knotty problem in controlling directional well trace.
sentences.chinese: 在定向井轨迹控制中，方位控制是个棘手问题。

sentences.english: Orchestrating the interactions with several resources becomes slightly more involved.
sentences.chinese: 编排与多个资源的交互是个棘手的问题。

sentences.english: And we would need, to have to look at it, and it's going to be very tricky, by the way, as to what the right answer is.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要去看一看，顺便说下，正确答案可能很棘手。

sentences.english: White spot syndrome virus (WSSV) disease is a key problem in shrimp culture industry in Asian countries.
sentences.chinese: 对虾WSSV病是亚洲对虾养殖业中的一个棘手问题。

sentences.english: But it’s the political challenges that will be most hellacious.
sentences.chinese: 但是最为棘手的将是政治方面的难题。

sentences.english: To talk about a water crisis hides intractable problems such as poverty.
sentences.chinese: 谈论水危机掩饰了诸如贫穷这样棘手的问题。

sentences.english: These are all difficult issues in the world context.
sentences.chinese: 这些都是在世界背景下的棘手问题。

sentences.english: When others interfere in the affair, it always makes troubles.
sentences.chinese: 别人一卷入这一事件，棘手的事情就来了。

sentences.english: Actual slot machines are far more complicated, and balancing the payout is tricky.
sentences.chinese: 实际的老虎机要复杂得多，并且结算奖金十分棘手。

sentences.english: Deciphering food labels is tricky business.
sentences.chinese: 解读食品标签是一件棘手的事情。

sentences.english: Leaders need confidence to confront gnarly problems and deep divisions.
sentences.chinese: 领导要有信心面对棘手的问题和很深的分裂。

sentences.english: There is one trickiness about this reaction.
sentences.chinese: 关于这个反应有个棘手处。

definition: to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
to feel embarrassed or awkward/to make things difficult (for someone)/to find things difficult (to do or manage)
lit. to have one's hands bound and be unable to do anything about it (idiom); fig. helpless in the face of a crisis
lit. badly burned about the head (from trying to put out a fire) (idiom)/fig. hard-pressed/under pressure (from a heavy workload, creditors etc)
